Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a RESTful API client for interacting with GitHub Copilot and CoCoPilot services, including token retrieval and request execution capabilities.

Class Description: The ApiClient class provides functionality to interact with GitHub Copilot and CoCoPilot APIs. It handles HTTP requests, manages headers, and processes responses. The class maintains a reusable HTTP client with configurable timeouts and generates unique identifiers for tracking requests.

Attributes:
- client: OkHttpClient - The HTTP client instance used for making requests
- machineId: String - A unique identifier generated for the machine (static final)

Methods:
- ApiClient() -> None - Constructor that initializes the HTTP client with timeout configurations
- generateMachineId() -> String - Generates a unique machine identifier using UUID (private static)
- getCopilotToken(String apiKey) -> String - Retrieves a Copilot token using the provided API key
- getCoCoToken(String apiKey) -> String - Retrieves a CoCoPilot token using the provided API key
- executeRequest(String url, String method, String body, Map<String, String> headers) -> Response - Executes a generic HTTP request with specified parameters
- createHeaders(String chatToken) -> Map<String, String> - Creates a standard set of headers for API requests using the provided chat token
